title: Write real content for Fleet Management blog post
description: post-1.md has a compelling title ('Fleet Management, the new Everest') and custom image, but the body is lorem ipsum placeholder text. Write the actual article content.

title: Fix site base_url and OG metadata
description: config.json base_url is still 'https://astroplate.netlify.app' and meta_description is 'astro and tailwind boilerplate'. This means OG images, canonical URLs, and social share metadata all point to the wrong domain. Update base_url to the actual deployment URL and write a real meta_description.

title: Remove unused template images
description: Several images in public/images/ are leftover Astroplate assets not used by any content: banner.png, keyboard.png, laptop.png, service-1.png, service-2.png, service-3.png, avatar.png, avatar-sm.png, call-to-action.png. Remove to reduce repo size.

title: Add a logo or refine text-only branding
description: The logo and logo_darkmode fields in config.json are empty strings, falling back to text 'Platform Pragmatist'. Either design and add a simple logo image, or intentionally style the text logo for a polished look.

title: Add recent posts section to homepage
description: The homepage currently shows a banner and one feature block, but doesn't surface any blog posts. Most blog homepages show 2-3 latest posts so visitors can immediately see content without clicking through to /blog.

title: Clean up or remove disabled Call-to-Action section
description: The CTA section (sections/call-to-action.md) is disabled but still contains Astroplate boilerplate ('Ready to build your next project with Astro?'). Either customize it for Platform Pragmatist (e.g., newsletter signup) or delete the content file.

title: Replace placeholder meta descriptions across site
description: Multiple pages have 'this is meta description' as their meta_description. Update with real descriptions: about/-index.md, blog/post-2.md, authors/-index.md, blog/-index.md. These are visible in search engine results and social shares.

title: Enhance homepage subtitle with personal context
description: The homepage subtitle 'A Pragmatic Approach to Platform Engineering' works but is generic. Consider adding a brief line about who Jake is to help first-time visitors (e.g., 'Insights from a platform engineering leader managing 4,000+ apps on Kubernetes').

title: Replace Astroplate announcement banner
description: The announcement banner still links to the Astroplate GitHub repo asking users to star it (config.json:27). Either disable it (set enable: false) or replace with your own announcement content.

title: Clean up or remove disabled Testimonials section
description: The testimonials section (sections/testimonial.md) is disabled but contains fake 'Marvin McKinney' placeholder entries. Remove the file unless testimonials will be used.

title: Add second feature block to homepage
description: The homepage has only one feature block ('You're in the right place if...'). Consider adding a second block, e.g., 'What you'll find here' with bullet points about content themes (Kubernetes, platform engineering, team leadership, etc.) to give visitors more context.

title: Remove template blog post (post-2)
description: post-2.md is a boilerplate Astroplate post: 'How to build an Application with modern Technology' by 'Sam Wilson' with lorem ipsum body and a placeholder image. Remove it or replace with real content.

title: Update footer copyright and meta author
description: Footer copyright says 'Designed And Developed by Zeon Studio' (config.json:33). Meta author is set to 'zeon.studio' (config.json:54). Update both to reflect Platform Pragmatist / Jake Walden.

title: Configure contact form action
description: The contact form action is set to '#' (config.json:32) so the form doesn't submit anywhere. Either integrate with a service (Netlify Forms, Formspree, etc.) or remove the contact page from navigation until ready.

title: Remove template author profiles
description: john-doe.md, sam-wilson.md, and william-jacob.md are Astroplate template authors. Remove them and ensure only real authors (Jake Walden) remain. Create a proper jake-walden.md author profile if one doesn't exist.

title: Decide on Disqus comments integration
description: Disqus comments are configured but disabled (config.json). Decide whether to enable comments on blog posts (and set up a real Disqus shortname), use an alternative, or remove the integration entirely.

title: Set up Google Tag Manager or analytics
description: GTM is configured but disabled (config.json). Set up a GTM container ID if you want to track site analytics, or remove the GTM config if not needed.
